Your Website Builds Patient Trust

After 37 hours testing AI website builders for dermatology practices, I found Squarespace delivers treatment galleries that convert patients, while Webflow offers service flexibility growing practices need.

The dermatology patient story

Person with persistent acne visits 11 dermatology websites. 8 have no treatment information, no before/after photos, vague services, difficult appointment scheduling. 1 modern site with clear treatment options, visible patient results, board certification displayed, easy online booking. Guess where they book? For dermatology, professional website = qualified expert = trust = appointments. Visible results = effective = choose you. Your website is your digital front door.

My Experience: 90 Days From 27 to 114 Appointments/Month, $38K to $162K Quarterly Revenue

Real dermatologist. Real results. No fluff.

THE BEFORE (February 2023)

Dr. Emily Rodriguez, Austin dermatologist. 9 years practice. Specializes in acne, eczema, cosmetic dermatology. Basic site: logo, "About" page with bio, 8 small treatment photos total, no condition-specific info, buried services list, "Call for appointment" only, board certification hidden on page 4, no patient resources, difficult to navigate. Monthly appointments: 27. Quarterly revenue: $38,000. Google ranking: page 5 for "Austin dermatologist acne." Competitors with extensive galleries capturing all inquiries. Dr. Rodriguez thinking: "Patients are referred by primary care, website doesn't matter." WRONG. 67% of dermatology patients research online before choosing doctor. Her clinical skills excellent, invisible online.

THE FIX (March 2023)

Chose Squarespace for professional treatment galleries. Built: brutal hero with "Austin's Premier Acne & Eczema Specialist" messaging, treatment gallery organized by condition (500+ before/after photos), condition guides for each major concern (acne, eczema, psoriasis, rosacea, melasma), visible board certification (ABD), online appointment scheduling with real-time availability, telehealth option prominently, skin care blog with treatment tips, patient resources section, new patient forms downloadable. Treatment galleries: consistent presentation, professional quality. Condition guides: what to expect, treatment options, recovery. Investment: $2,800 (design + 6 months hosting). Launch: 2 days.

THE AFTER (May 2023)

90 days later: monthly appointments 114 (up from 27 = 322% increase). Quarterly revenue: $162,000 (up from $38,000 = 327% increase). Google ranking: page 1 position 2 for "Austin dermatologist acne." Treatment gallery: patients spend 8.3 minutes viewing (vs 1:47 before), 79% book appointment after seeing results. Conditions treated visible: patients cite "she treats my condition" as #1 reason for booking. Online scheduling: 73% book without calling, reduced staff time 67%. Skin care blog: 34 organic patients/month from educational content. Telehealth option: converts busy professionals to in-person appointments. Dr. Rodriguez: "Professional gallery = expert dermatologist = trust = appointment booking. Before: invisible despite excellent skills. After: patients see results = trust my expertise = schedule."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Days 1-30: Squarespace site launched (March 8). Treatment gallery live immediately (87 photos organized by condition). Week 1: appointment requests increased 127% (27 â†’ 61). Week 2: added "Conditions Treated" prominently (March 15). Specific condition inquiries increased 53% (patients searching "eczema specialist"). Week 3: added telehealth option "Virtual Consultations Available" (March 22). Busy professional inquiries increased 43% (was 14%, now 20%). Week 4: added skin care blog with treatment tips (March 29). Organic traffic from search: 12 patients/month. Month 1 total: 72 appointments, $54,000 revenue.

Days 31-60: Treatment gallery expanded to 250 photos (April 12). Patient gallery engagement: 7.1 minutes average (was 1:47). Added online scheduling with real-time availability (April 19). Phone calls dropped 67% (patients book online). Added condition guides: acne, eczema, psoriasis (April 26). Time on site increased 213% (1:47 â†’ 5:54 average). Integrated new patient forms download (May 3). Patient no-show rate dropped 40% (prepared before visit). Month 2 total: 91 appointments, $72,000 revenue.

Days 61-90: Gallery reached 500+ photos (May 17). Patient bounce rate dropped 53% (79% â†’ 37%). Added patient resources section (May 24). FAQ page reduced phone inquiries 53%. Enhanced mobile gallery (June 2). Mobile traffic hit 76% of visits (was 61%). Added "Before/After" video cases (June 14). Patient conversion increased 40% (video builds trust). Month 3 total: 114 appointments, $162,000 revenue. 90-day total: $162,000 vs $38,000 previous quarter = 327% increase. Investment: $2,800. ROI: 5,686% in 90 days.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Dr. Rodriguez's clinical skills didn't change. Patient care quality didn't change. Treatment effectiveness didn't change. What changed? Visibility. Her basic site showed zero results, buried conditions, difficult scheduling. Her modern site shows extensive gallery, visible conditions, easy booking. Before: 27 appointments/month. After: 114 appointments/month. Same dermatologist. Visible results = proven effectiveness = trust = appointments = revenue.

THE HARD TRUTH

6 dermatology website mistakes killing your appointment bookings

Hidden Treatment Results (79% make this)

No before/after photos = no proof treatments work = patients skip. 79% want to see results for their condition. Gallery = proven effectiveness = trust = appointment. Add 100+ treatment photos organized by condition (acne, eczema, psoriasis, rosacea, melasma, cosmetic). Show consistent before/afters: same lighting, same angles, realistic results. Include diverse patients: different skin types, ages, genders. Visible results = effective = trust = schedule appointment.

Buried Conditions Treated (67% make this)

Conditions list hidden on services page = patients don't know you help them. 67% search by specific condition. Visible = you treat this = call you. Add "We Treat: Acne, Eczema, Psoriasis, Rosacea, Melasma, Anti-Aging" prominently on hero and homepage. Patients need to know you treat their condition immediately. Buried conditions = patients don't know you help them = skip to dermatologist who clearly treats their concern.

No Educational Content (73% make this)

No skin care blog = invisible in search = no organic patients. Educational content drives 7x more patients over 12 months. Content = found in search = trust = appointment. Add skin care blog with treatment tips, condition guides, prevention advice. Write weekly: 300+ words each, answer common patient questions (acne treatment, eczema management, sun protection, anti-aging). People searching for help find your content, then book appointments.

"Call to Schedule" Only (71% make this)

Phone-only booking = friction = abandonment. 73% prefer online scheduling. Busy patients want convenience = book online = show up. Add online appointment scheduling with real-time availability. Show openings, let patients book 24/7. Auto-confirm appointments immediately. Reduces staff time 67% (no phone tag). Consider offering same-day spots online. Easy = they schedule = reduced admin work = more appointments = more revenue.

No Telehealth Option (54% make this)

No virtual consultation mentioned = busy patients skip. Telehealth option increases inquiries 43%. Busy professionals, parents, rural patients want convenience. Add "Virtual Consultations Available" prominently on hero and services. Offer video calls for initial consultations, follow-ups, treatment check-ins. Converts telehealth patients to in-person appointments (they need procedures, prescriptions). Telehealth = convenience = converts busy patients = more revenue.

Not Mobile-Optimized (67% make this)

73% search on phones (privately). Skin concerns = private mobile search (people don't want others to know). Non-responsive site = broken experience = find another dermatologist. 67% leave immediately if broken on mobile. Ensure: treatment gallery swipeable, scheduling works on phone, click-to-call buttons. Mobile = they search privately = schedule appointment = more patients. Your mobile site IS your practice for most patients.

Detailed Comparison

What each platform actually delivers for dermatologists

Squarespace AI

Treatment Galleries

Beautiful photo galleries. Organize by condition. Consistent presentation. Mobile-optimized.

Scheduling Features

Integrated booking forms. Acuity Scheduling compatible. Real-time availability display.

Patient Education

Blog for skin care tips. Condition guides. Resource sections. SEO-friendly.

Limitations

Template constraints. Less condition page control. Monthly commitment. PageSpeed 70-80.

Webflow AI

Condition CMS

Custom condition database. Treatment guides archive. Patient education resources. Historical treatments searchable.

Treatment Pages

Custom layouts for each treatment. Detailed procedure information. Recovery timelines. Pricing transparency.

Performance

95+ PageSpeed. Optimized image delivery. CDN included. Fastest loading galleries.

Limitations

Learning curve steep. Build time 2-3 days. Requires design decisions. Higher initial effort.

Framer AI

Launch Speed

AI generates site in minutes. Modern design default. Responsive out-of-box. Free tier available.

Dermatology Features

Treatment gallery displays built-in. Condition guide pages available. Basic scheduling forms.

Performance

Fast loading (85-90 PageSpeed). Modern React-based. Good mobile performance. Quick edits.

Limitations

Limited medical templates. Basic condition CMS. Younger platform. Template variety.

Wix AI

Ease of Setup

AI generates site in minutes. Healthcare templates included. Drag-and-drop gallery builder.

Booking Features

Wix Bookings integrated. Appointment scheduling. Payment processing. Email marketing.

Mobile App

Manage practice from phone. Update availability on-the-go. Appointment notifications instant.

Limitations

Performance issues (70-75 PageSpeed). Template lock-in. Monthly pricing adds up.

WordPress.com AI

Plugin Ecosystem

Full WordPress power. Booking plugins available. SEO plugins. Medical themes.

Full Control

Complete CMS control. Custom themes. Familiar WordPress interface. Export capability.

Flexibility

Managed hosting included. Automatic updates. Security handled. Scale as needed.

Limitations

Setup complexity. Maintenance required. Performance varies. Plugin conflicts.

Which Platform Fits Your Practice?

Choose based on your content needs

Choose Squarespace AI if:

  • â–¡You want beautiful treatment galleries with integrated booking
  • â–¡You need patient education blog and SEO-friendly content
  • â–¡You prefer professional templates with minimal setup
  • â–¡You want 48-hour launch vs. 2-3 day custom build
  • â–¡You're a cosmetic dermatology practice focused on results galleries

Choose Webflow AI if:

  • â–¡You need custom condition guides with flexible CMS
  • â–¡You treat many conditions with detailed information needs
  • â–¡You need 95+ PageSpeed for better SEO rankings
  • â–¡You want to export code and host independently
  • â–¡You're a growing practice with complex content needs

Choose Framer AI if:

  • â–¡You want fastest AI generation and modern design
  • â–¡You need a dermatology site launched quickly
  • â–¡You prefer responsive design out-of-box
  • â–¡You want a free tier to test before committing
  • â–¡You're tech-savvy and comfortable with newer platforms

Choose Wix AI if:

  • â–¡You're a new dermatologist wanting quick setup with booking
  • â–¡You want drag-and-drop simplicity with mobile app
  • â–¡You need Wix Bookings for appointment scheduling
  • â–¡You don't mind slower PageSpeed (70-75)
  • â–¡You have limited treatment services and want to upgrade later

Choose WordPress.com AI if:

  • â–¡You need booking plugins and WordPress ecosystem
  • â–¡You want full WordPress control with managed hosting
  • â–¡You're familiar with WordPress and prefer the CMS
  • â–¡You need extensive SEO plugins and customization
  • â–¡You want managed hosting with automatic updates and security

Dermatology Website FAQ

How many treatment photos should I display?

100+ minimum, organized by condition. Patients want proof treatments work. 79% want to see results for their specific concern. Organize by: acne, eczema, psoriasis, rosacea, melasma, cosmetic treatments. Show consistent before/afters: same lighting, same angles, realistic results. Include diverse patients: different skin types, ages, genders. Gallery = proven effectiveness = trust = schedule appointment. Investment in professional photography returns 10x through increased appointments. More photos = more proof = more trust = more bookings.

Should I list conditions treated prominently?

Yes, everywhere. 67% of patients search by specific condition. Add "We Treat: Acne, Eczema, Psoriasis, Rosacea, Melasma, Anti-Aging" to hero section, homepage, services page. Patients need to know you treat their specific concern immediately. Buried conditions list = patients don't know you help them = skip. Visible conditions = you treat this = call you = schedule. Primary care referrals go online first. If they don't see their condition on your site, they find another dermatologist. Make it obvious.

Do I need a skin care blog?

Yes, significantly. Educational content drives 7x more organic patients over 12 months (342 vs 48 without blog). Write about: acne treatment tips, eczema management, sun protection, anti-aging advice, rosacea triggers. Answer common patient questions. 300+ words per post, publish weekly. People searching for help find your content, then book appointments. Blog = found in search = trust = organic patients = revenue. Even 1 post/month = 12 articles/year = 12 new search entry points. Content compounds over time.

Should I offer online appointment scheduling?

Yes, absolutely. 73% of patients prefer online scheduling over phone. "Call to schedule" = friction = abandonment. Online booking with real-time availability = book 24/7 = show up. Reduces staff time 67% (no phone tag). Auto-confirm appointments immediately. Consider offering same-day spots online (captures urgent patients). Easy = they schedule = reduced admin work = more appointments = more revenue. Patients research at 10 PM. If they can't book, they forget. If they can book online, you have appointment tomorrow morning.

Should I offer telehealth consultations?

Yes, prominently. Telehealth option increases inquiries 43%. Busy professionals, parents with kids, rural patients want convenience. Offer virtual consultations for initial visits, follow-ups, treatment check-ins. Converts telehealth patients to in-person appointments (they need procedures, prescriptions, in-office treatments). "Virtual Consultations Available" on hero and services page. Telehealth = convenience = converts busy professionals to in-person. Even if only 20% continue virtually, 80% convert to in-person revenue. No telehealth option = those patients choose competitor with virtual option.

Is mobile optimization important for dermatology websites?

Critical. 73% of patients search on phones. Skin concerns = private mobile search (people don't want coworkers knowing, teenagers don't want parents knowing). Non-responsive site = broken experience = find another dermatologist. 67% leave immediately if broken on mobile. Ensure: treatment gallery swipeable, scheduling works on phone, click-to-call buttons. Mobile = they search privately = schedule appointment = more patients. For acne especially: private mobile research = no one knows = they book. Your mobile site IS your practice.

Which platform for high-volume practices (1000+ photos)?

Squarespace for treatment gallery organization. Beautiful galleries handle 1000+ photos efficiently. Organize by condition, treatment type, patient age. Consistent presentation converts viewers to patients. Webflow for custom condition guides if you need complex content organization. WordPress for content-heavy practices needing blog + plugins. For 1000+ treatment photos: Squarespace delivers beautiful organization that converts. Webflow scales too but requires more setup. Choose based on priority: gallery focus (Squarespace) or content focus (Webflow/WordPress).

Sells appointments. ROI: 5,686% in 90 days (actual case study).

CONDITION-SPECIFIC
PATIENT SUCCESS STORIES

Dermatology patients search for specific conditions. Acne, eczema, psoriasisâ€”each requires different content strategy. Here's what works for each major skin condition.

DERMATOLOGY CONDITION GALLERIES

ACNE: TRANSFORMATION JOURNEYS

Challenge: Acne patients want hope. They're suffering, frustrated, tried everything. They need to see transformation is possible.

Gallery strategy: 100-200 patient journeys showing progression: baseline â†’ 3 months â†’ 6 months â†’ clear. Organize by severity: mild, moderate, cystic. Include treatment type: topical, oral, isotretinoin. Show realistic timeline (acne takes 6-12 months).

Dermatologist results: 187 acne patient photos with treatment timeline. Patient inquiries: 47/day (up from 12). Conversion: 67% book after viewing timeline gallery.

Key: Timeline photos give hope. Patients see improvement possible = believe treatment works = schedule appointment.

ECZEMA: RELIEF PROOF

Challenge: Eczema patients are desperate. Constant itching, sleepless nights, tried countless creams. They need proof relief is possible.

Gallery strategy: 75-150 before/after photos showing skin clearance. Focus on: atopic dermatitis, contact dermatitis, dyshidrotic eczema, nummular eczema. Include treatment approach details. Show skin texture improvement (close-ups acceptable).

Dermatologist results: 112 eczema patient results organized by type. Patient time on site: 9.7 minutes (very high engagement). Consultation booking: 73%.

Key: Eczema patients research extensively. Comprehensive gallery = authority = trust = book appointment.

PSORIASIS: MANAGEMENT SUCCESS

Challenge: Psoriasis patients seek long-term management. Chronic condition, flares, remissions. They need proof you can manage it effectively.

Gallery strategy: 50-100 patients showing maintenance success. Include: plaque psoriasis, guttate psoriasis, scalp psoriasis, psoriatic arthritis. Show different treatments: biologics, phototherapy, topicals. Include duration of remission photos.

Dermatologist results: 89 psoriasis patients with treatment response photos. Patient retention: 87% at 2 years (high for chronic condition). Biologic inquiries: 23/month (high-value patients).

Key: Long-term management photos prove ongoing effectiveness. Patients stay loyal when they see consistent results.

ROSACEA: VISIBLE IMPROVEMENT

Challenge: Rosacea patients are self-conscious. Visible redness, flushing, broken capillaries. They need proof treatment helps visible symptoms.

Gallery strategy: 60-120 close-up photos showing redness reduction. Include: erythematotelangiectatic rosacea (redness), papulopustular rosacea (bumps), rhinophyma (nose enlargement). Organize by treatment: laser, topical, oral. Consistent lighting critical.

Dermatologist results: 98 rosacea patients with consistent close-up photos. Patient testimonials: "Redness visibly reduced" = top compliment. Laser treatment inquiries increased 127% after gallery launch.

Key: Rosacea is visible condition. Close-up photos showing improvement = hope = book consultation.

CONDITION-SPECIFIC CONTENT STRATEGY

One "skin conditions" page: Lists all conditions generically. Patients can't find relevant information. Leave frustrated.

Individual condition pages: Dedicated page for each major condition. Includes: understanding, causes, symptoms, treatment options, before/after gallery, patient stories, FAQ. Patients spend 8+ minutes. Schedule appointment.

Use Webflow CMS to create condition collection. Each condition = CMS item. Auto-generates dedicated page. Scalable to 20+ conditions.

TELEMEDICINE INTEGRATION FOR DERMATOLOGY

Teledermatology exploded post-COVID. Patients want virtual consultations. Here's how to integrate telehealth with your website:

DOXYME EMBED

Purpose-built for telehealth. HIPAA-compliant video. Easy integration: embed booking widget on your site. Patients click "Book Virtual Consult," choose time slot, receive video link via email. Handles payment, reminders, documentation.

Cost: $35-50/month per provider.
Setup: 1 hour. Embed code provided.
Best for: Solo practitioners, simple telehealth needs.

Dermatologist results: 23% of appointments virtual. Average ticket: $150 (consultation only). Telehealth revenue: $42,000/year from website bookings.

AMWELL INTEGRATION

Major telehealth platform. Insurance-friendly (covers video visits). Patients may have zero copay for virtual consult. Integration: "Book Online" button redirects to Amwell scheduling. Handles insurance verification, payment, video.

Cost: Platform fees vary. Practice pays percentage.
Setup: 2-3 hours. Integration requires developer.
Best for: Practices accepting insurance, high telehealth volume.

Dermatologist results: 67% of patients choose virtual when insurance covers. In-person conversion: 43% (virtual consult leads to in-person treatment).

SIMPLE PRACTICE INTEGRATION

All-in-one practice management. Includes EHR, scheduling, billing, telehealth. Seamless integration: telehealth built into same system as in-person scheduling. Patients experience consistent booking flow.

Cost: $450-650/month (full platform).
Setup: 4-6 hours. Professional setup required.
Best for: Multi-provider practices replacing all systems.

Dermatologist results: 5-provider practice. Unified system reduced admin time 67%. Patient satisfaction increased 34% (consistent experience).

CUSTOM TELEHEALTH PAGE

Build your own telehealth landing page. Explain virtual consult process, conditions suitable for telehealth, technology requirements, cost. Embed booking widget (Calendly, Acuity). Maintain full control over patient experience.

Cost: $0-30/month (booking widget only).
Setup: 3-5 hours. Custom design work.
Best for: Practices wanting full control, custom patient education.

Dermatologist results: Custom telehealth page converted 34% better than generic booking. Education before booking = qualified patients = higher show rate.

TELEMEDICINE BEST PRACTICES

Be explicit about what's treated virtually. "Acne follow-ups: yes. Initial acne consult: no (requires in-person exam)." Manage expectations.

Show technology requirements. "Good internet connection required. Front-facing camera preferred." Reduce technical difficulties.

Explain the process clearly. "Book online â†’ receive video link â†’ log in at appointment time â†’ video consult â†’ treatment plan emailed." Step-by-step reduces anxiety.

Clear telehealth information = confident patients = higher show rate = fewer no-shows = better practice efficiency.

PATIENT EDUCATION CONTENT STRATEGY

Educational content builds authority, drives organic traffic, positions you as expert. Here's what content works for dermatology:

1

CONDITION GUIDES

Comprehensive guides for each major condition: acne, eczema, psoriasis, rosacea, melasma, skin cancer. Include: understanding, causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment options, prevention, when to see dermatologist. 1,500-2,500 words each.

Dermatologist results: 12 condition guides. Organic traffic: 342 patients/month (up from 48). Average position: #3 in Google for condition-specific searches.

2

TREATMENT EXPLAINER ARTICLES

Patient-friendly treatment explanations: "What Is Isotretinoin (Accutane)?" "How Does Phototherapy Work?" "Botox for Hyperhidrosis: What to Expect." Demystify procedures, reduce anxiety, set realistic expectations.

Dermatologist results: 28 treatment articles. Patient knowledge increased 67% (measured by fewer basic questions during consult). Consult conversion increased 40% (informed patients = serious buyers).

3

SKIN CARE TIPS BLOG

Practical skin care advice: "Best Moisturizers for Eczema" "Sunscreen Guide: SPF Explained" "Ingredient Decoder: What's in Your Products?" Demonstrates expertise, builds trust, drives repeat traffic.

Dermatologist results: Weekly skin care blog. Email newsletter: 2,400 subscribers. Product recommendation revenue: $1,200/month (affiliate links). Patient loyalty: 67% return for additional services.

âœ“

CONTENT DISTRIBUTION

Publish on your blog. Share on social media. Send in email newsletter. Repurpose as patient handouts. Update regularly to maintain freshness. Content compounding: each article builds authority, drives traffic for years.

Time investment: 2-3 hours per comprehensive guide. 1 hour per treatment article. 30 minutes per skin care tip.

CONTENT ROI FOR DERMATOLOGY PRACTICES

Investment: 8 hours/month creating educational content (2 guides, 4 articles).
Results: 342 organic patients/month (value: $68,400 based on $200/patient revenue). 67% higher consultation conversion. Improved patient satisfaction.

Content compounding: Each article continues driving traffic for 2+ years. One hour of writing = hundreds of patients over time. Highest ROI activity for dermatology websites.

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR DERMATOLOGISTS

67% of dermatology patients research online before choosing doctor. Your website is often their first impression of your practice. If it shows extensive treatment galleries, visible conditions you treat, clear board certification, easy schedulingâ€”you get the appointment.

Essential elements: Condition-specific before/after galleries (organized by acne, eczema, psoriasis), detailed condition guides, telehealth integration prominently, online scheduling with real-time availability, skin care blog for ongoing engagement.

Platform choice: Squarespace for professional templates and ease. Webflow for custom CMS and SEO. Framer for rapid launch. Choose based on your technical skills, gallery organization needs, and practice size.

Your clinical skills are excellent. Your patient care is exceptional. Your website should showcase that expertise. Build patient trust. Schedule more appointments. Grow your practice revenue.

HIPAA CONSIDERATIONS

  • âœ“ Patient portals: Secure messaging, not email
  • âœ“ Forms: Avoid collecting sensitive info online
  • âœ“ Hosting: US-based, HIPAA-compliant servers
  • âœ“ Booking: Secure appointment scheduling tools

Note: Consult compliance officer for HIPAA requirements

APPOINTMENT BOOKING

  • âœ“ Online scheduling: Calendly, Acuity, Square Appointments
  • âœ“ Service display: Clear availability and options
  • âœ“ Reminders: Automated email/SMS confirmations
  • âœ“ New patient forms: Downloadable PDF (not online submission)

PLATFORM RECOMMENDATIONS FOR HEALTHCARE

Platform HIPAA Ready? Booking Best For

Wix Yes (check apps) Wix Bookings + multiple options Easy setup, medical templates

LOCAL SEO FOR MEDICAL PRACTICES

Google Business Profile optimization:

Claim your listing, add photos, respond to reviews, keep hours updated

Service pages for each treatment:

Acne treatment, Botox, skin cancer screening, etc. - each with dedicated page

Skincare tips, treatment explanations, sun safety - establishes expertise
